entry.title: New release for Iso: v1.0.0
entry.content:
https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/d8ffe824-2cec-4df1-8da7-33fa2cf1d19c

Hello everyone! This past week, I've quietly been working on the first official release of Iso. What started as a simple one-page dashboard now has auth and a fully featured editor.

Migration

Please read the updated README for instructions on how to install and use the new release. There are breaking changes, especially regarding how the config volume is mounted. The config itself remains largely the same, so you can copy over your existing services to the new one.

Thanks, Tim

entry.title: New release for Iso: v1.1.0
entry.content:
Hello everyone!

It’s been a week since the v1 release of Iso. Since then, I’ve been working on some of the feature requests you shared with me, including: - A search bar that supports various providers, including custom ones like SearXNG - Background images for light/dark mode with adjustable opacity and blur

I also worked on a few quality-of-life improvements: - More Icons - An overhauled settings menu

I've also taken your suggestions about renaming Iso into account. The rename will happen with the release of v2. 'Mosaic' has been decided as the new name.

Thanks, Tim

entry.title: New release for Iso: v1.2.0
entry.content: This release adds a slim version of the Docker image. This image includes only a handful of icons, rather than the entire pack, which greatly reduces its size.
